description: Condition modifiers, terrain intervals, and recovery procedures for the Extended Tracking System

conditionModifiers.name: Blood Trail
conditionModifiers.description: Target is leaving a blood trail - highly visible and provides consistent tracking signs

conditionModifiers.name: Fresh Injury
conditionModifiers.description: Target is actively bleeding - leaves blood drops and moves slower

conditionModifiers.name: Multiple Targets
conditionModifiers.description: Two or more targets leave more signs of passage, making tracking easier

conditionModifiers.name: Recent Rain
conditionModifiers.description: Rain washes away footprints, scent, and other tracking signs

conditionModifiers.name: Target Deliberately Hiding
conditionModifiers.description: Target is actively concealing their trail through counter-tracking techniques

conditionModifiers.name: Familiar Territory
conditionModifiers.description: Tracker knows local terrain, common paths, and likely hiding spots

equipmentBonuses.name: Basic Survival Kit
equipmentBonuses.description: Basic tools for wilderness survival including simple tracking aids

equipmentBonuses.name: Tracker's Kit
equipmentBonuses.description: Specialized tracking equipment including magnifying lens, scent trackers, and measurement tools

terrainCheckIntervals.description: Flat or gently rolling terrain with minimal obstructions. Tracks visible at distance but degrade faster from wind.
Partially collapsed structures with navigable paths. Tracks protected from elements but multiple paths exist.
Heavily damaged urban environment with many obstacles. Many possible routes require frequent reconfirmation.
Maze-like environment requiring constant navigation. Each junction point requires a new tracking check.
Unstable environment affected by Glitch corruption. Paths may alter, making tracking extremely difficult.

recoveryProcedures.description: Retrace steps to find where the trail was lost. Quickest option with no DC penalty.
recoveryProcedures.bestUsedWhen: Trail was recently lost and tracker is confident about where they went wrong

recoveryProcedures.description: Methodical search pattern covering a wider area. More thorough than backtracking but harder.
recoveryProcedures.bestUsedWhen: Unsure where the trail was lost or when backtracking has already failed

recoveryProcedures.description: Return to last confirmed trail location and start fresh. Most time-consuming but most thorough.
recoveryProcedures.bestUsedWhen: Last resort when other recovery methods have failed or tracker is completely disoriented

closingInModifiers.description: Within 500 feet of target. Target may detect pursuit.
Within 100 feet of target. Contested vs target's Perception.
Within 50 feet of target. Automatic success - immediate encounter.

estimateTargetCount.description: Contested check to estimate how many targets are being tracked

estimateTrailAge.description: Check to estimate how old the trail is
